key_point: 主詞為第三人稱單數時，動詞需要加上 -s
explanation: 在現在簡單式中，當主詞是第三人稱單數（he, she, it）時，動詞需要加上 -s。

examples.chinese: 他每天清晨跑步。
examples.user_answer: He run every morning.
examples.correct: He runs every morning.

key_point: 句型結構不自然，應使用更簡潔的表達方式。
explanation: 使用 'To my surprise' 或 'What surprised me was...' 結構更自然。另外，'should object' 在此處不自然，直接用過去式 'objected' 即可。
original_phrase: What made me surprised is he should object

examples.chinese: 讓我很驚訝的是，他竟然在會議中公開反對老闆的提案。
examples.user_answer: What made me surprised is he should object the propose by the boss in the session in public.
examples.correct: 令我驚訝的是，他竟然在會議中公開反對老闆的提案。

key_point: 單字使用不精確， 'propose' 是動詞，這裡需要名詞 'proposal'。
explanation: 'propose' 是動詞，意為「提議」，而這裡需要名詞 'proposal'，意為「提案」。

examples.chinese: 讓我很驚訝的是，他竟然在會議中公開反對老闆的提案。
examples.user_answer: What made me surprised is he should object the propose by the boss in the session in public.
examples.correct: 令我驚訝的是，他竟然在會議中公開反對老闆的提案。

key_point: 介系詞使用不當， 'by the boss' 應該是 'of the boss'。
explanation: 表示「老闆的提案」使用 'of the boss' 比較自然。

examples.chinese: 讓我很驚訝的是，他竟然在會議中公開反對老闆的提案。
examples.user_answer: What made me surprised is he should object the propose by the boss in the session in public.
examples.correct: 令我驚訝的是，他竟然在會議中公開反對老闆的提案。

key_point: 用字遣詞略顯生硬，'in the session in public' 可以簡化。
explanation: 將 'in public' 改為副詞 'publicly'，並將 'session' 改為更常用的 'meeting'，表達更自然。也可以用'in the meeting publicly'，語意一樣。

examples.chinese: 讓我很驚訝的是，他竟然在會議中公開反對老闆的提案。
examples.user_answer: What made me surprised is he should object the propose by the boss in the session in public.
examples.correct: 令我驚訝的是，他竟然在會議中公開反對老闆的提案。

key_point: 動詞誤用，應使用'seen'而非'seem'，冠詞使用錯誤。
explanation: 'Seem' 是「看起來」的意思，此處應使用 'see' 的過去分詞 'seen'，表示「被視為」。 另外冠詞 the 可以省略。

examples.chinese: 他被視為最佳候選。
examples.user_answer: He was seem as the best candidate.
examples.correct: 他被視為最佳候選人。

key_point: 主詞動詞一致性錯誤
explanation: 當主詞是第三人稱單數（She, He, It）時，現在簡單式的動詞需要加上 -s。學生忘了加上 -s，屬於主詞動詞一致性的系統性文法錯誤。

examples.chinese: 她每天早上跑步。
examples.user_answer: She run every morning.
examples.correct: She runs every morning.

key_point: 形容詞用法錯誤：interesting vs. interested
explanation: 形容詞 interesting 用於描述事物本身的特性，而 interested 用於描述人對某事物的感受。因為這裡要表達的是「我」對計畫感興趣，所以應該使用 interested。正確的搭配是 be interested in。

examples.chinese: 我對這個計畫很感興趣。
examples.user_answer: I am interesting in this plan.
examples.correct: I am interested in this plan.

key_point: 動詞時態和主謂一致錯誤
explanation: 這裡需要使用動名詞 'facing' 作為 'despite' 的賓語。 'Challenge' 需要是複數形式，因為有很多挑戰。 'Numerous' 使句子更正式。

examples.chinese: 儘管面臨諸多挑戰，他仍然堅持追求自己的夢想。
examples.user_answer: Although face many challenge, he still persist pursue his dream.
examples.correct: Despite facing numerous challenges, he persevered in pursuing his dream.

examples.chinese: 儘管面臨諸多挑戰，他仍然堅持追求自己的夢想。
examples.user_answer: Although face many challenge, he still persist pursue his dream.
examples.correct: Despite facing numerous challenges, he persevered in pursuing his dream.

key_point: 更自然的連接詞
explanation: 雖然 'Although' 在語法上沒有錯，但使用 'Despite' 更簡潔，也更適合這裡的語境。 'Despite' 後面直接接名詞或動名詞。

examples.chinese: 儘管面臨諸多挑戰，他仍然堅持追求自己的夢想。
examples.user_answer: Although face many challenge, he still persist pursue his dream.
examples.correct: Despite facing numerous challenges, he persevered in pursuing his dream.

key_point: 情態動詞後不應再接助動詞 will。
explanation: 情態動詞（modal verbs）如 might, can, should, must 等，後面直接接原形動詞，不能再接助動詞 will。在這裡，might 已經表達了可能性，will 是多餘的。

examples.chinese: 這項研究的結果可能會對醫學領域產生深遠的影響。
examples.user_answer: This research result might will have profound effect on medical field.
examples.correct: The results of this research may have a profound impact on the medical field.

key_point: effect 的正確搭配介系詞。
explanation: Effect 和 impact 後面搭配介係詞 on 是正確的用法。 表示『對...的影響』。因此，使用 effect on 或 impact on 都是正確的。

examples.chinese: 這項研究的結果可能會對醫學領域產生深遠的影響。
examples.user_answer: This research result might will have profound effect on medical field.
examples.correct: The results of this research may have a profound impact on the medical field.

key_point: 可數名詞 field 的單複數使用。
explanation: 這裡的 medical field 指的是整個醫學領域，是一個泛指的概念，需要使用定冠詞 the。或者可以使用 medical fields，表示醫學的各個領域

examples.chinese: 這項研究的結果可能會對醫學領域產生深遠的影響。
examples.user_answer: This research result might will have profound effect on medical field.
examples.correct: The results of this research may have a profound impact on the medical field.

key_point: result的表達更自然的方式。
explanation: 雖然 'This research result' 在語法上沒有問題，但 'The results of this research' 是更常見且自然的表達方式。使用 results 可以更強調研究的結果。

examples.chinese: 這項研究的結果可能會對醫學領域產生深遠的影響。
examples.user_answer: This research result might will have profound effect on medical field.
examples.correct: The results of this research may have a profound impact on the medical field.

key_point: 時態錯誤
explanation: 原句意為「直到深夜他才意識到」，需要使用過去完成時態表示在深夜之前已經犯下錯誤。此外，'until'引導時間狀語從句時，主句通常使用否定形式，並使用倒裝結構。這裡使用'It wasn't until...that...'結構更為自然。
correction: It wasn't until late at night that he realized

examples.chinese: 直到深夜他才意識到自己犯了一個嚴重的錯誤。
examples.user_answer: Until late night he realize he make a serious mistake.
examples.correct: It wasn't until late at night that he realized he had made a serious mistake.

key_point: 動詞時態
explanation: 由於整個句子描述的是過去發生的事情，所以 'realize' 應該用過去式 'realized'。 並且因為犯錯是先於意識到的行為，所以用過去完成時 'had made' 更能表達時間順序。

examples.chinese: 直到深夜他才意識到自己犯了一個嚴重的錯誤。
examples.user_answer: Until late night he realize he make a serious mistake.
examples.correct: It wasn't until late at night that he realized he had made a serious mistake.

key_point: 冠詞缺失
explanation: 名詞 'mistake' 是可數名詞，單數形式需要冠詞 'a'。
correction: he had made a serious mistake

examples.chinese: 直到深夜他才意識到自己犯了一個嚴重的錯誤。
examples.user_answer: Until late night he realize he make a serious mistake.
examples.correct: It wasn't until late at night that he realized he had made a serious mistake.

key_point: 條件句時態錯誤
explanation: 這是一個與過去事實相反的假設語氣，需要使用過去完成式 (had + 過去分詞) 在條件子句中。而且句子的結構需要主詞。
correction: If I had taken your advice

examples.chinese: 如果當初聽從你的建議，現在就不會陷入這樣的困境。
examples.user_answer: If listen your advice before, now won't be in such difficult.
examples.correct: If I had taken your advice, I wouldn't be in such a difficult situation now.

key_point: 否定縮寫和助動詞使用錯誤
explanation: 在假設語氣的結果子句中，需要使用 would/could/might + have + 過去分詞。由於現在是強調現在的狀態，所以使用wouldn't be. 此處也需要添加主詞。

examples.chinese: 如果當初聽從你的建議，現在就不會陷入這樣的困境。
examples.user_answer: If listen your advice before, now won't be in such difficult.
examples.correct: If I had taken your advice, I wouldn't be in such a difficult situation now.

key_point: 介系詞使用錯誤
explanation: 這裡需要使用 'situation' 這個名詞，且 difficult 作為形容詞修飾 situation。 因此需要冠詞 'a'。

examples.chinese: 如果當初聽從你的建議，現在就不會陷入這樣的困境。
examples.user_answer: If listen your advice before, now won't be in such difficult.
examples.correct: If I had taken your advice, I wouldn't be in such a difficult situation now.

key_point: 表達方式更自然
explanation: 雖然 'in such a difficult situation' 文法正確，但更常見也更自然的表達方式是 'in this predicament' 或 'in this mess'，但在這個評估中，學生使用的方式是正確的。

examples.chinese: 如果當初聽從你的建議，現在就不會陷入這樣的困境。
examples.user_answer: If listen your advice before, now won't be in such difficult.
examples.correct: If I had taken your advice, I wouldn't be in such a difficult situation now.

key_point: 被動語態與介係詞的錯誤使用。
explanation: 此處需要使用過去分詞 'considered' 作為形容詞，而非被動語態的 'be considered as'。 'Considered' 本身就帶有「被認為是」的意思。 Also, the phrase 'be considered as' is often considered redundant.

examples.chinese: 被認為是本世紀最偉大的科學發現之一。
examples.user_answer: Be considered as one of the greatest scientific discover in this century.
examples.correct: Considered one of the greatest scientific discoveries of this century.

key_point: 名詞單複數錯誤
explanation: 因為是「其中之一」，所以必須使用複數名詞 'discoveries'。 否則會變成「一個最偉大的發現中的一個」，邏輯不通。

examples.chinese: 被認為是本世紀最偉大的科學發現之一。
examples.user_answer: Be considered as one of the greatest scientific discover in this century.
examples.correct: Considered one of the greatest scientific discoveries of this century.

key_point: 介係詞使用錯誤。
explanation: 要表達「本世紀的」，應該使用介係詞 'of'，例如： the greatest discoveries of this century。

examples.chinese: 被認為是本世紀最偉大的科學發現之一。
examples.user_answer: Be considered as one of the greatest scientific discover in this century.
examples.correct: Considered one of the greatest scientific discoveries of this century.

key_point: 主詞動詞不一致
explanation: 英文中，第三人稱單數（he, she, it）在現在簡單時的動詞需要加上 -s 或 -es。

examples.chinese: 儘管他工作非常努力，卻總是事倍功半，這讓他感到非常沮喪。
examples.user_answer: Although he work very hard, he always do more but earn less, this  makes him fell terribly depressed.
examples.correct: Although he works very hard, he always achieves less than expected, which makes him feel terribly frustrated.

examples.chinese: 他每天清晨跑步。
examples.user_answer: He go jogging every morning.
examples.correct: He goes jogging every morning.

key_point: 動詞時態錯誤
explanation: 這裡需要使用現在簡單時，且表達“事倍功半”用 “achieves less than expected” 更自然。直接翻譯成“do more but earn less”雖然能理解，但較不道地。
original_phrase: he always do more but earn less
correction: he always achieves less than expected

examples.chinese: 儘管他工作非常努力，卻總是事倍功半，這讓他感到非常沮喪。
examples.user_answer: Although he work very hard, he always do more but earn less, this  makes him fell terribly depressed.
examples.correct: Although he works very hard, he always achieves less than expected, which makes him feel terribly frustrated.

key_point: 主詞動詞不一致，以及錯誤的動詞形式
explanation: 1. 'this' 指代前面整句話，所以要用 which 引導非限定子句。2. make + sb. + do sth.，這裡 fell 應該使用原型 feel。3. depressed 指心情低落，frustrated 更符合“沮喪”的語境，表示因為無法達到目標而感到灰心。
original_phrase: this makes him fell terribly depressed
correction: which makes him feel terribly frustrated

examples.chinese: 儘管他工作非常努力，卻總是事倍功半，這讓他感到非常沮喪。
examples.user_answer: Although he work very hard, he always do more but earn less, this  makes him fell terribly depressed.
examples.correct: Although he works very hard, he always achieves less than expected, which makes him feel terribly frustrated.

key_point: 用詞遣字可以更精準
explanation: 雖然 'depressed' 沒有文法錯誤，但在表達因努力卻徒勞無功而產生的挫敗感時，使用 'frustrated' 更為準確。

examples.chinese: 儘管他工作非常努力，卻總是事倍功半，這讓他感到非常沮喪。
examples.user_answer: Although he work very hard, he always do more but earn less, this  makes him fell terribly depressed.
examples.correct: Although he works very hard, he always achieves less than expected, which makes him feel terribly frustrated.

key_point: 動詞時態：現在簡單式主詞為第三人稱單數時，動詞需要加上 -s
explanation: 在現在簡單式中，如果主詞是第三人稱單數（he, she, it），動詞需要加上 -s。因為主詞是 'He'，所以動詞 'run' 應該改為 'runs'。

examples.chinese: 他每天清晨跑步。
examples.user_answer: He run every morning.
examples.correct: He runs every morning.
